identificationModule.briefTitle: Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of the Maurora® DES in ICAS
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Prospective, Multi-center, Randomized Controlled Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of the Maurora® Sirolimus-Eluting Stent Versus the Apollo Stent in Intracranial Atherosclerotic Stenosis(Maurora ICAS Trial)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of the RCT trial is to evaluate whether implantation of drug-eluting stent (DES) is more efficacious than bare metal stent (BMS) in prevention of in-stent restenosis (ISR) and improvement of outcomes for symptomatic intracranial atherosclerotic stenosis. This trial is prospective, multi-center, randomized 1:1 single blind trial using Maurora sirolimus eluting stent versus Apollo bare metal stent conducted in approximately 10 interventional neurology centers in China. The study is sponsored by Alain Medical (Beijing) Co., Ltd.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This trial is a prospective, multi-center, 1:1 randomized using drug-eluting (Sirolimus) stent versus bare metal stent (BMS) to treat intracranial stenosis of 70-99% degree. The primary endpoint is in-stent restenosis rate(ISR) within 12 months after revascularization procedure of the qualifying lesion during follow-up.

armGroups.label: Maurora® Sirolimus Eluting Stent System
armGroups.description: Device: Maurora® Sirolimus Eluting Stent System A sirolimus eluting intracranial stent system with platform is made of L605 CoCr alloys.
interventionNames: Device: Maurora® Sirolimus Eluting Stent System

armGroups.label: APOLLO™ Intracranial Stent System
armGroups.description: Device: Apollo Intracranial Stent System A 316L stainless steel balloon-expandable intracranial stent system.

interventions.name: Maurora® Sirolimus Eluting Stent System
interventions.description: The Maurora® for intracranial PTA treatment comprises of a balloon expandable sirolimus eluting stent and a delivery catheter that features a rapid exchange catheter design with a semi-compliant balloon located at its distal end.

interventions.name: APOLLO™ Intracranial Stent System
interventions.description: The Apollo stent system comprises of a balloon expandable stent and a delivery catheter that features a rapid exchange catheter design with a semi-compliant balloon located at its distal end.

primaryOutcomes.measure: In-stent restenosis rate(ISR) within 12 months after procedure
primaryOutcomes.description: Angiographic evidence of in-stent stenosis ≥50% at 12 months after procedure

secondaryOutcomes.description: Implantation success was defined as successful arrival of stent to the lesion and subsequent release of the stent delivery system.
Technical success was defined as successful arrival of stent to the lesion and subsequent release of the stent delivery system with a residual stenosis of \<30%.

Clinical success was defined as successful arrival of stent to the lesion and subsequent release of the stent delivery system with a residual stenosis of \<30%, and free from major adverse event within 12 months after procedure.

system with a residual stenosis of \<30%

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Stroke or death within 30 days after procedure
secondaryOutcomes.description: Any stroke included ischemic stroke or/and symptomatic brain hemorrhage and all-cause death.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Stroke in the target vessel territory or death within 30 days after procedure
secondaryOutcomes.description: Death or any stroke events related to target vessel after revascularization.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Ischemic stroke in the target vessel territory between 31 day to 1 year after procedure
secondaryOutcomes.description: Any ischemic stroke events related to target vessel after revascularization.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: between 31 day to 1 year after procedure

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Ischemic stroke in other vessel territory between 31 day to 1 year after procedure
secondaryOutcomes.description: Any ischemic stroke events unrelated to target vessel after revascularization.Ischemic stroke is defined as a new focal neurological deficit of sudden onset, that is associated with infarction lesion on CT or MRI. Ischemic strokes are classified as in or out of the territory of the symptomatic intracranial artery.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: between 31 day to 1 year after procedure

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Any ischemic stroke between 31 day to 1 year after procedure
secondaryOutcomes.description: Ischemic stroke is defined as a new focal neurological deficit of sudden onset, that is associated with infarction lesion on CT or MRI. Ischemic strokes are classified as in or out of the territory of the symptomatic intracranial artery.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: between 31 day to 1 year after procedure

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Any subdural, epidural hemorrhage or a systemic hemorrhage between 31 day to 1 year after procedure
secondaryOutcomes.description: Any subdural or epidural hemorrhage or a systemic hemorrhage is required hospitalization, blood transfusion, or surgery.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: between 31 day to 1 year after procedure

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Death between 31 day to 1 year after procedure
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: between 31 day to 1 year after procedure

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Transient Ischemic Attack within 1 year after the procedure
secondaryOutcomes.description: A transient ischemic attack (TIA) is a temporary period of symptoms similar to those of a stroke. A TIA usually lasts only a few minutes up to 24 hours and doesn't cause permanent damage.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Functional outcome measured by the modified Rankin Scale
secondaryOutcomes.description: Focus on difference between 1 month and 12 months after procedure. The range of modified Rankin Scale was from 0 to 6. 0-No symptoms; 1-No significant disability; 2-Slight disability; 3-Moderate disability; 4-Moderately severe disability; 5-Severe disability; 6 -Dead. A higher score indicates worse a outcome.

otherOutcomes.description: Any complications including vascular complications of assess the intracranial arteries, Allergic reactions or hypersensitivity to agents or device in procedure, complications of intracranial arteries, infection, fever, bleeding and other events.

otherOutcomes.measure: adverse events (AE) and serious adverse events (SAE)
